intro: Conyza subspathulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf horseweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields, roadsides, and prairies. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery underside, and it produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seeds. Conyza subspathulata is an annual plant that is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
